website_summaries.verdict: The width may be a little narrow for some equipment, but this mat offers great noise and vibration suppression for apartment dwellers.
pros: Dampens vibrations and equipment noise very well
Works as a personal exercise mat
cons: Overall durability is a common complaint
Too soft to protect flooring from heavier equipment

customer_reviews.title: Unrolled and stayed flat right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent pad for gym equipment. It was part of the suggested purchases with my Sunny Health and Fitness spinning bike. I have it on a hard floor and it provides just the right amount of cushioning without the bike being unstable. I would say it is more cushioning on average that the other mats I have and have seen. It arrived on time and unrolled and stayed flat which i appreciated because i was really eager to try out the new bike!
customer_reviews.author: LRRE

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for a spin bike
customer_reviews.text: Used it under my Peloton bike. Nice quality and the perfect size.
customer_reviews.author: I. A. Levy

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly for Bowflex MAX Trainer
customer_reviews.text: Bowflex tries to sell a slightly smaller mat for $99 on their website. This may does the job perfectly. I use this on carpet.
customer_reviews.author: P120D1GY

customer_reviews.title: All around solid mat
customer_reviews.text: Good mat. I'm using it for jumping rope (I use Crossropes which are coated steel cables). I think it is a sturdy mat for the price. It isn't tearing up, kicking up any bits of residue, which cheaper mats tend to do after jumping on it relentlessly hundreds of jumps at a time. And they also help cushion my ankles/knees. If it lasts me 6 months I'd buy it again for $30. I have a hard time finding a good mat that is compact enough not to interfere with my jumping technique yet has enough spring to provide protection from the floor. Yep, sound investment.
customer_reviews.author: lalapreachin

customer_reviews.title: Ripped when setting up
customer_reviews.text: Got this mat to put under my spin bike on top of carpet. It is very thin and ripped while rolling the bike onto it before it was ever even used. This might be good for light exercise but I would not recommend it if putting heavy equipment on top of it.
customer_reviews.author: Erin C

customer_reviews.title: Quality Jump Rope Mat
customer_reviews.text: Decided to try out the Crossrope workout trend and was in the market for a sturdy equipment mat. For the price, Supermats was definitely a viable non-slip affordable option to handle the repetition of weighted ropes and soften the echo on a garage floor surface. Furthermore, after a quick workout, the mat was fairly easy to wipe down for the next usage. Side note: If mat is folded and not rolled/stored properly, the material will crease in that shape which will take a small period of time to mold back flat.
customer_reviews.author: Pancho

customer_reviews.title: Will Stain your Hardwood Floor!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely horrible - left a deep yellow stain on our hardwood floor that cannot be removed. We have to replace the wood panels. DO NOT RECOMMEND! This is not safe for your hardwood, especially if you have light wood.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great! But...
customer_reviews.text: I have to say I love this heavy duty mat. I use it as a yoga mat and sometimes put a my bike fluid trainer on it. I would have given it 5 stars, but it’s a little stinky. The rubber smell stays in my carpet but you can’t notice unless you get really close. To compromise I just roll it up and put it in the closet when I’m not using it rather than leaving it on the ground as a designated work out spot.
customer_reviews.author: HB Local

customer_reviews.title: Great mat for protecting your floor from exercise equipment!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this mat for under my new upright bicycle to protect my floor. It's a great mat except the first few days it smelled bad. I ended up sending that bike back and the new bike I ordered comes with it's own mat, so I'm going to use this mat for doing floor exercises now. It's a lot cushier and better quality than my thin yoga mat so I'll keep this one (especially since the smell went away after a couple of days after removing it from the shipping box). I'm very happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: #1 Amazon Fan!

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money!
customer_reviews.text: Looks great until you try to pick it up and move it! Try picking it up, left 2 holes in the mat and some stuck to the floor...what a disaster!! Looking to get a refund...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Appears as advertized
customer_reviews.text: It is really made of a good quality of whatever. I have placed a large sheet of wrapping paper under it as I saw one of the customer had a problem when it left a large amount of residue on the wooden floor .So in order to avoid that that I used this sheet of paper before laying this mat. Keep checking q monthly for any residue. Thank You.
customer_reviews.author: Prakash Beharilal

customer_reviews.title: Good buy!
customer_reviews.text: Bought to keep my spin bike steady and my carpet intact. It's doing the job. Good buy!
customer_reviews.author: Jessa

customer_reviews.title: Works well under my bike trainer. Just right in ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well under my bike trainer. Just right in terms of thickness and protection. I use it on top of thick carpet and is working well. It came rolled up and rolled out flat without any issues. This would also work well on hard floors.
customer_reviews.author: Digitali

customer_reviews.title: Basically a yoga mat
customer_reviews.text: I put the mats down and then set my stationary bike on it and literally left a hole in the mat. I haven't even used the bike yet and there is a hole in the mat. These are as thin as a yoga mat, and a yoga mat might actually be more durable than these.
customer_reviews.author: samantha

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: Stuck to the floor without any equipment on it yet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bought this for my treadmill and it's AWESOME! Thick
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my treadmill and it's AWESOME! Thick, great quality construction and no issues with poke-through, or corners staying rolled under after removing from the box. Since I had just moved when I received this, I ended up leaving it coiled in its box for over a month and it relaxed instantly when I rolled it out on the floor. One of the best gym type mats I've owned; I've been a gym girl for many years, and this is the best! I am super loyal to this brand!
customer_reviews.author: daniellejean11

customer_reviews.title: Tore as soon as I rolled bike into it.
customer_reviews.text: Tore as soon as I rolled my peloton onto it. Now in have a giant hole. Literally had it delivered an hour ago.
customer_reviews.author: ycontrol928

customer_reviews.title: DON’T BUY! Cheap Junk.
customer_reviews.text: I’m extremely dissapointed with this mat. Its a thin cheap material nothing like the what the reviews said. It weighs maybe 1 pound which tells me it will not last as i brought it strictly for outdoor use. I notice the older reviews from 3-4 years ago talk about how thick and heavy this mat is. I wonder if it was made better back then.
customer_reviews.author: Jah

customer_reviews.title: Ehh
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a mat to put under a spin bike. This material feels great to the touch. The issue is it collapses under any force that even pinching it I can almost get it down to nothing. The indentation on my bike wheel is serious that I think it will tear apart without much use. It's major use will now be to minimize the sweat on the carpet beneath, but in terms of protection I don't trust it from not breaking through. I thought it would be more substantial rubber that wouldn't give so easily. This has a lot of air woven in.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: Works as described. Put this mat under my Airdyne bike that is on a carpeted floor to catch sweat and protect the carpet. My only minor complaint is that the mat is almost too soft for my application (this may be a pro for some uses, but its a con in my case) - the weight of an exercise bike not to mention a person digs into the material pretty hard, not sure how long it will hold up or if it will really protect the carpet.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony B.

customer_reviews.title: It held up well for four years
customer_reviews.text: I used this mat for a lot of vigorous exercises for over four years. It provided good cushioning and tolerated a lot of sweat. I did not use it for equipment, at all. The mat has performed well for over four years; however, it has lately begun to deteriorate. I have noticed small pieces flaking off in little balls and sticking to my skin and clothes. No complaints! For the price I don't think I could have found a better deal. I don't know how it would work out for Yoga. Yoga practitioners might want to consider a Manduka Pro.
customer_reviews.author: Hank

customer_reviews.title: Strong smell out of the box!
customer_reviews.text: The mat seems to be sturdy. It has a good weight,not too heavy to lift, and it lays flat without curled up edges. I will be using it under a stationary bike-so I will see how it holds up to the friction from the bike. The only thing is that the mat has a VERY strong plastic smell. I have it airing out on the porch. I hope that the smell dissipates.
customer_reviews.author: mommy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a bowflex M5
customer_reviews.text: Love it! It's not too thick or thin. It has great give to it and was a perfect fit for my M5. It's much cheaper then purchasing one from bowflex and I can't imagine the bowflex one being any better then this. I would definitely recommend this mat!
customer_reviews.author: S. Butera

customer_reviews.title: Sticks to floor permanently
customer_reviews.text: Sticks to the floor and peels apart when you pull it up.
customer_reviews.author: motorbike rider

customer_reviews.title: Pad for Exercise  Bike
customer_reviews.text: I just got the Norditrack s221. This pad fits under the bike perfectly. I have it on our hardwood floors and the pad does not move or slip while I ride. The thickness is great and it is easy to wipe up sweat or water.
customer_reviews.author: LAURA

customer_reviews.title: Works great BUT it will stain your jumprope and floor
customer_reviews.text: The padding is great BUT they fact that my jumprope has black marks everywhere and so does my floor is a big issue. Should be a warning about it.
customer_reviews.author: L. Gabriel G.

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to my garage gym
customer_reviews.text: I use this mat under my Rogue Echo bike. It isn’t as heavy duty as the horse mats I use for my garage gym, but I didn’t need another one either. For the price, this did exactly what I wanted. It’s perfect size and easy to move around, unlike the heavy horse mats. I cleaned it after the summer ended and moved it with my bike to my basement for winter workouts.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Hagen

customer_reviews.title: This is a total rip off. Please do not buy this very soft and weak mat!
customer_reviews.text: This mat is too soft and weak for the price. My very light small treadmill rip through the moment it was placed under it. It has no durability whatsoever! This is a total rip off! I just received this yesterday July 22nd and I'm returning it right away.
customer_reviews.author: C. marshall

customer_reviews.title: Falling apart and makes a mess all over
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this mat for 3 months and it’s disintegrating- i have to sweep my floors after each time I use it in my wood floors. It leaves a huge mess of speckled plastic all over. It also gets all over me, so I’m filthy after I work out on it- it looks like I’ve been rolling in dirt or I’m covered in dark freckles. The mat also tears easily. I wish this mat would have been better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Haley Wood

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: The exercise bike I use made a vibrating noise when I used it because it was on a hardwood floor. I purchased a mat and placed the mat under my exercise bike and what a difference. Turned the bike from a noisy bumpy exercise into a quiet and smooth ride. My wife liked it so well she purchased an additional one to put under her elliptical machine, same great effect. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Mat to stand on while at my dog grooming table. It's nice and durable. It's not super thick but just enough to keep my feet and legs from aching while standing stationary all day. Also, the price was perfect for this product. I had been searching online all day until I came across this one. It was the cheapest one that I could find for it's size. Totally worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great service
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mat to place under my exercise bike to protect my floor and limit noise level. It works very well and I am very pleased with this product. I would highly recommend and would purchase from this seller again.
customer_reviews.author: Rifky Weinberger

customer_reviews.title: Not that heavy duty.
customer_reviews.text: Not as heavy duty as it states. It tore a few days after putting it down and using it. Unfortunately it wasn't until after I finish putting my workout gym together so I was past the return date.
customer_reviews.author: Ny155

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, scratches easily
customer_reviews.text: I use this under my Peloton bike. It protects the floor and catches sweat, but it scratches pretty easily and dog hair clings to it like crazy! My roomba also does a number on it and makes a grinding sound when moving over it. Had it since May and it looks pretty beat up at this point, but I'm not sure if that's expected or a quality issue.
customer_reviews.author: KLE

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Mat For Jump Roping
customer_reviews.text: This mat is fantastic, I bought it to use while I jump rope and it is amazing! Highly recommend for anyone looking for a great mat.
customer_reviews.author: Oss

customer_reviews.title: Rips very easily
customer_reviews.text: I've had this only a couple weeks and already it has 2 chunks of mat ripped out. Not sure why. Sometimes I roll the mat up gently at the ends where there is extra hangover from elliptical machine and it seems it's ripping from that. Just from rolling the end like a yoga mat.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Works better than I thought with how thin it is
customer_reviews.text: It has held up for several months under my exercise bike. I move the bike angle a bit when I want to watch TV while riding. You can see the usual indents in the material from the weight of the bike and rider and, but they go away after a while. No rips so far from the bike feet digging into it. The sweat wipes up easily enough and I don't see signs of wear. I am happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Class3up

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: Mat is described for use under a stationary bike. However, after the first day there was a hole. Not sure if mine is defective, but it doesn’t appear to be very durable at all. Would not recommend purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Eboni B

customer_reviews.title: Great Mat!
customer_reviews.text: I was ecstatic to see the quality of this mat when it arrived. I purchased it to put under my 3-1 Elliptical bike system and it works perfectly to keep me stable and protect my machine. Super easy to clean as well!
customer_reviews.author: Tay C.

customer_reviews.title: Shouldn’t tear under weight of equipment
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed with this. I bought the recommended ma fir the schwinn cycling bike. After taking bike from box I didn’t put it together for four days. Just the weight of bike sitting on the matin that’s time put a hole where the front spinning tire sits.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does it's job
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to go underneath my Echelon bike and it does exactly what I needed it to do. It's on the carpet and the bike is super study sitting on it. If I'm dripping sweat, it's easy to clean this off instead of having that sweat dripping into the carpet beneath the bike (gross). I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Noni

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality. I use it for jumping rope and it's good cushioning for leg joints. I've left it outside in 100 degree weather and rain, and it's same quality as new. If I don't forget I typically bring it inside my garage.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent A.

customer_reviews.title: Bike Mat
customer_reviews.text: It is just what I needed. I am not planing on moving the bike, so it is perfect for me. I would not recommend to drag wheels of heavy equipment on it, you will have to place it on top of the mat to avoid damaging it. Thank you for the fast delivery.
customer_reviews.author: RDY

customer_reviews.title: Great mat at great price
customer_reviews.text: Love this mat! I have it under a rowing machine on a ceramic tile floor, and it works great. The rower feels more cushy now than when it was directly on the floor, maybe because it's more secure & doesn't move around at all. Haven't seen any marks on the floor since I started using it, so happy about that, too, as the rower left black marks before. Was worried about the thickness of the mat, as some reviewers described it as thin, but it seems thick enough for my purposes. May not work as well for a heavier piece of equipment, however. Overall very happy w/purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Island Girl

customer_reviews.title: It's a big rubber mat...
customer_reviews.text: As described. Again I use this term not callously but enthusiastically. Just what I was looking for! I am using this under a schwin stationary m exercise bike. It came within 2 days (fast!) and fit just perfectly. The best part is how durable it is. Gives support and seems pretty rip resistant. I pulled it up the other day and kg hardwood eucalyptus floors look perfect. No abrasion or contact points. No sticking or residue. And to boot the thing unrolled easily and didn't curl on the edges / corners.
customer_reviews.author: J. Rotondo

customer_reviews.title: Not really suitable for heavy equipment
customer_reviews.text: As some other posters have noted, the mat is insufficiently dense for heavy equipment, including an exercise cycle. The mat appears to be well made and sturdy, and the first impression is that it is dense. But the equipment definitely compresses the pad pretty completely. It will help keep sweat off the carpet but will do a less satisfactory job keeping the impressions of the equipment off the floor. As I learned after the fact, "Heavy Duty P.V. C." does not mean "solid pvc" which would have been a better choice for me. It could work as a yoga or exercise mat.
customer_reviews.author: PaulT

customer_reviews.title: Not heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: This mat is advertised as heavy duty but has no resistance to depressions and provides no support to keep from damaging carpet underneath the mat with a recumbent exercise bike on it. Within hours of the bike being placed on the mat on carpet there was a large depression in the carpet that we had to work to get back to normal so who knows how bad it would have been in weeks or months. Is very soft and probably would be a good anti-fatigue mat but not a heavy duty protection mat as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: WS

customer_reviews.title: Would continue shopping...
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not odor free... will revisit this at a later date.
customer_reviews.author: Alwin Mathew

customer_reviews.title: Does The Job
customer_reviews.text: I was very happy with the first and ordered the second mat. And I was relieved when it arrived and was not 3 inches high as the product dimensions had it as. It is 60 inches x 30 inches x .3 inches (if that high). *Product Dimensions should be corrected because someone out there might actually be expecting to place work out equipment on some mat that really is 3 inches high! :) Thank you once again for the great mat.
customer_reviews.author: Mark V. Cafeo

customer_reviews.title: Good solid value priced equipment mat
customer_reviews.text: Bought this mat for a new spin bike since the gyms have been closed for months. Seems pretty durable so far and easy to clean. It did not have any odor when I first opened it which is common with these mats and yoga mats. No issues with wrinkles and it stays flat on the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Sue Barrett

customer_reviews.title: Will DAMAGE your floor - do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Awful. It worked well at first for its intended purpose - as a mat under an exercise bike to protect the floor. Only problem is that when I went to move the bike, the mat had adhered to the floor. This is not in a hot or too cold climate. If you want a good mat without the headache, you should buy anything but this.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl B

customer_reviews.title: Save you money for something nicer
customer_reviews.text: These did not last very long, stuck to my concrete floors and ripped to shreds when I tried to pull them up. These are also super thin and will not protect your floors if you drop weights on them.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Peil

customer_reviews.title: Not good for spin shoes with cleats.
customer_reviews.text: I use this mat under my spin bike. It’s the perfect size for my setup. I only gave it a 3 star rating because I have spin shoes with SPG cleats attached and if you step on the mat with the shoes on it will leave indentions all the way through the mat. I ended up putting a towel down where I step to stop it from happening.
customer_reviews.author: Robert serviss

customer_reviews.title: Best workout mat ever
customer_reviews.text: I actually don't use this to out equipment on, I needed something sturdier then a yoga mat and heavier to do body weight training on. I always found every mat I found on the market would slide around or not heavy enough. This is definitely thick enough and 'meaty' so that it doesn't move and still cushions your feet if you are training on it.
customer_reviews.author: Tory Thai

customer_reviews.title: Fine quality mat
customer_reviews.text: This is great mat. Thick, but pliable and soft. It provides a solid foundation for my Schwinn Air Dyne exercise bike on my carpet and protection from sweat. It seems to also prove some noise damping. Shipped in a convenient space saving box. Recommended and I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: T.G. 51

customer_reviews.title: seems to work fine for our exercise bike
customer_reviews.text: Its a bit thinner and floppy than I expected. seems to work fine for our exercise bike.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for jumping rope
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a mat that I could jump rope on, that would give some cushion for my knees, and also save my rope from getting torn up on the cement. It is perfect. I've been using it for a month. It is still in perfect condition. My knees hurt less, and my rope has been saved.
customer_reviews.author: Ann E. Gelety

customer_reviews.title: Great Mat.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with my Saris M2 Smart Trainer, it works great, and seems to be just as durable as the Saris mat....at a considerably lower price.
customer_reviews.author: Denny

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Mat for Exercise Equipment
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect size and quality for our new Schwinn Airdyne indoor bike. It unfolded well without staying curled up and there was minimal chemical odor that has already dissipated. We are pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Foster Angelou

customer_reviews.title: This is the perfect mat for my Peloton Bike
customer_reviews.text: This mat is the perfect size for my Peloton. The mat that comes with the bike is too long, and this one is perfect as well as the thickness and durability.
customer_reviews.author: T.Lee

customer_reviews.title: The quality is Amazing
customer_reviews.text: The thickness and the support that limits the sound of the rowing excercise bike to my apartment and the noise does not go downstairs to desturb my neighbors.
customer_reviews.author: jajay57

customer_reviews.title: A sturdy mat to use under my ellipitical
customer_reviews.text: Good size to fit my new ellipitical. Opened it up to let it air out after I bought it to reduce plastic smell. Glad I bought it to protect my carpet. Great price for this item
customer_reviews.author: kay930

customer_reviews.title: Good thickness and durability
customer_reviews.text: Mentioned it was correct length for a recumbent bike... just barely fits the Schwinn 270. However, very good quality and looks substantial
customer_reviews.author: RK

customer_reviews.title: Works well for my bike, it stops me from ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well for my bike, it stops me from moving when riding and works WELL catching the sweat from when im biking. Plus it saves my hardwood floor from scratches DEFINITELY BUY when you get a bike REALLY COMES IN HANDY
customer_reviews.author: David Scott Brown

customer_reviews.title: Stationary Bike on It
customer_reviews.text: We have a stationary bike on this mat and it works great o not only protect the floor but also reduce the noise the bike would make on the hardwood floor.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn C Gaffney

customer_reviews.title: Good mat to put down and place exercise equipment on top
customer_reviews.text: Got this to put down on wood flooring underneath my recumbent exercise equipment. Easy to clean, prevents scratching of the floor, and for that I'm just relieved.
customer_reviews.author: An Empty-Nester

customer_reviews.title: Very nice quality
customer_reviews.text: Great mat and well made - believe they are made in the U.S. I use it to exercise on, it is plush and rolls up. I use it mostly for using my cable jump rope Cross Rope..will see how it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Too fragile.
customer_reviews.text: This mat is too fragile and easy to tear. It got torn simply by stepping on it. There are better choices.
customer_reviews.author: THE Brian

customer_reviews.title: Great Mat, easy to clean.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great mat. The mat is durable, and cleans easily. It's textured, which I wasn't expecting, but actually prefer. The texture helps the equipment stay-put, as well as makes it better when I use it for myself. It works well for an exercise bike, as well as for doing cardio. I also do T25/Insanity using this mat, and highly recommend it for both! It has the right amount of give, without being to soft. Good choice.
customer_reviews.author: Edwardo Lindeloff

customer_reviews.title: Perfect mat for equipment and weights.
customer_reviews.text: This is way better for putting equipment and weights on than toga mats or carpets. It's thick and dense but still spongy enough to reduce impact. We don't have level tiles in our house and put a stationary bike on top of this and we can't tell, it's rock solid. It's texture feels good too. This is exactly what I hoped it would be.
customer_reviews.author: MYL

customer_reviews.title: perfect for racing bike + trainer
customer_reviews.text: I use this under a bicycle on a trainer for riding indoors. It is really solid and tough. Pretty thick mat, so there is no vibration or noise (essential since I am in an apartment and don;t want my downstairs neighbors to hate me). This thing is way tougher than anythign else I have seen, and perfect for putting a bike and trainer on, or probably a treadmill or exercize bike.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan B. Krause

customer_reviews.title: Heavy protection for floor.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be durable. Heavy. Protects the floor. Had some Out gassing initially but was left outside a few days before being brought in and was fine.
customer_reviews.author: TinyForest

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Star removed for saying this is "Heavy Duty." While it's not what I call heavy duty (what I would consider to be in a Gold's Gym), it has help up so far. I would prefer to call this "durable" than "heavy duty" but that's just my opinion. I bought three sets of these to put under my gym setup, which I use largely for lifting weights. I will continue this review in terms of longevity after I test them out with a few workouts. Edit 12/21/2013. They're holding up. Increasing score. I'll likely buy another set to expand my mat area.
customer_reviews.author: Rated R Cars

customer_reviews.title: Good traction.
customer_reviews.text: We use this in our vet clinic to give the dogs a place to stand where they have for traction. Our tile floors are very slippery. This may has made a huge difference!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha P.

customer_reviews.title: great mat
customer_reviews.text: it fit well under my equipment and is easy to clean for sure. i wish it were a bit stiffer but this is indeed a great mat.
customer_reviews.author: daniel

customer_reviews.title: Work Out Mat
customer_reviews.text: It is an excellent mat and is durable. For the money it is pretty good because it will last and you won't need to buy another one very soon. It arrived on time and I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ken T

customer_reviews.title: Don't let your cat claw on it.
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping. I'd give it five stars but two issue for me kept me from doing that. 1. It could be six inches longer for exercise. 2. the material is a too soft, maybe not very wearable long term, not sure though, my cat has decided to use it for a scratching pad and her claws easily ripped it up.
customer_reviews.author: Robert S.

customer_reviews.title: Peeerfect!
customer_reviews.text: Great mat! Perfect size for my spin bike. Catches all the sweat and wipes dry. It's actually softer and more pliable than I assumed--almost like a firm memory foam. It would also make a good floor mat for ab workouts or maybe even yoga.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron AthmannTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: I will use the mat and see if I like it. It got here before the bike actually ...
customer_reviews.text: I did not know if I need it under the exercise bike or not, but I took the initiative to get it just in case. When I get someone to set my exercise bike up for me, I will use the mat and see if I like it. It got here before the bike actually made it, and it was the last thing I ordered.
customer_reviews.author: Renee Grate

customer_reviews.title: As Ordered!
customer_reviews.text: This mat is a great way to protect our carpet under the eliptical machine. Good quality and helps even reduce any noise while working out.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby K.

customer_reviews.title: Thick, durable mat with almost no PVC odor
customer_reviews.text: Great product that's exactly what it says it is. And unlike other PVC mats I've used, there is almost zero smell - and it seems very durable. Another mat I purchased for twice the price (not from amazon) tore almost immediately when I positioned my workout bench on it - and has stankified my workout room with a PVC chemical scent for over a week now. The size of this one was absolutely perfect for my elliptical, as well. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Boston Kris

customer_reviews.title: Nice product!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Really nice mats! Should last a long time! I use the 2 I ordered under indoor stationary bike.
customer_reviews.author: PE

customer_reviews.title: Perfect mat.
customer_reviews.text: Great mat that does the job. We have this for a treadmill. We also have a BowFlex and the mat that came with this machine is of the exact same material/thickness. I looked at the length of the treadmill before I bought this and the 5 foot length is perfect. Some may need longer. We bought this for the Sunny Health & Fitness Treadmill:
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really great workout mat
customer_reviews.text: I used this mat under my workout bike. At first, I debated using a yoga mat but I'm so glad I didn't and opted for this one. It's heavier than your traditional workout mat, more durable, and super easy to clean. This was well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Marygrace

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice, works well.
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality mat for a really good price. Size and thickness was perfect for my Air Assault bike. Looks nice on the floor and definitely dampens the noise (for those downstairs) a lot.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: I am so disappointed to say as I was installing it and rolling ...
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to receive this today. I am so disappointed to say as I was installing it and rolling my treadmill onto it, it tore! I would expect this to be far more durable, during installation it can’t handle the wheels? Buy with caution.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Very patient mat... it waits.. and waits...
customer_reviews.text: Sits on the floor really nice... holds up the exercise spin bike like a champ... after 3 months, now wear and tear at all... but I figure that once I have time and energy to actually RIDE the bike... things might be a bit different...
customer_reviews.author: Boo-ee

customer_reviews.title: Superb cushioning for a thin mat, perfect under exercise equipment
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mat for under the Exerpeutic 900XL Extended Capacity Recumbent Bike with Pulse that I ordered from Amazon. It is a perfect fit with several inches to spare all around the bike, and protects my hardwood floors. It cleans easily and does not slip or slide. There is nothing about this mat that I do not like.
customer_reviews.author: H. Smith

customer_reviews.title: True to size and good workout mat
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my stationary bike but I use it for other workouts as well. works great and the ends flattened out nicely on its own.
customer_reviews.author: samantha

customer_reviews.title: Okay for light Exercises!
customer_reviews.text: While this seemed to be a sturdy mat, and maybe it is, for weight lifting and yoga. But if you are planning to do cross training and Cardio then the mat will scrape and leave a lot of small black dots. It wears out fast. The mat also moves if you are doing a lot of cardio and fast movements exercises. I still use it but looking for something more fit for heavy cardio workouts.
customer_reviews.author: M.C

customer_reviews.title: Great Mat! Thick and good quality!
customer_reviews.text: Really good price for it! Honestly the best mat that I bought until now!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I used this as a base for a spin bike. It is the right size and seems to be holding up well. I'm not sure that it was as rigid as I expected, but it's fine for my use case. I don't think I'd want to drop heavy weights on it though.
customer_reviews.author: M.H.

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: First day of use, I tried to roll my exercise bike forward an inch and instead of rolling it tore a hole through this.
customer_reviews.author: G. A Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a Peloton bike and needed a mat to put it on. The mat Peloton offered was around $70. I ordered this one to be more cost-conscious and it's absolutely perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy Customer
customer_reviews.text: The right side for my exercise bike. Fits prefect and is well made.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Very strong!
customer_reviews.text: This is a strong, flexible mat. A really good choice. I have my stand-in-place bike on it and I ride pretty often, it is an excellent protection to my floor.
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: Great Solution to Protect Your Floors
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say, but it is a good mat to use to protect your floor from any potential damage caused by many types of exercise equipment including spinning bikes, treadmills or weight benches. It was delivered rolled up but immediately flattened out when I put it down. Seems to be well made and should last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: DougR

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Great for under my spin bike in my appartment so downstairs neighbors don’t hear anything!
customer_reviews.author: Jac Jay

customer_reviews.title: No complaints, works well for my cycling bike
customer_reviews.text: This works great, no complaints. I used this for my Peloton cycling bike and fits perfectly. No complaints here.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Mat was great - just the right size.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, UPS won't deliver unless it fits in our rural mailbox so it was necessary to drive 15 miles to post office & wait till the weekend & holiday over to retrieve it from the post office.
customer_reviews.author: Hicksville

product_meta.title: Supermats Heavy Duty Equipment Mat 13GS Made in U.S.A. for Indoor Cycles Recumbent Bikes Upright Exercise Bikes and Steppers (2.5 Feet x 5 Feet) (30-Inch x 60-Inch) (76.2 cm x 152.4 cm)
product_meta.description: The Supermats Equipment mat is the perfect solution for your exercise equipment needs. This mat is manufactured in the U.S.A. in the Supermats company owned factory, using U.S.A. sourced materials. Supermats are made with no harmful chemicals or materials, and are safe for use around children and pets. Supermats offers the perfect solution to use with treadmills, ellipticals, recumbent bikes, rowers, steppers, upright and stationary bikes, and other cardio exercise units. These mats also work well as exercise mats for floor exercise. The heavy duty, durable vinyl composite construction will protect your equipment investment from dust, excess vibration, dampen noise, and will help extend the life of your equipment, while protecting your floors from damage.
feature_bullets: PROTECTIVE FLOOR MAT: Super-tough, durable mat helps protect your floors and carpets from the damaging effects of heavy exercise equipment and debris from mechanical parts
CUSHIONS EXERCISE EQUIPMENT FROM EXCESSIVE WEAR: Prolongs the life of your equipment by helping prevent floor and carpet dust from entering belts and mechanical parts

FITS INDOOR CYCLE AND STEPPER UNITS: The Supermats Stepmant / Bikemat is perfect for indoor cycles, steppers, exercise bikes, step-aerobics, or just general exercise stretching - mat measures 30" x 60"
DAMPENS VIBRATION: Helps prevent excessive wear and tear to equipment and muffles equipment noises so family and neighbors are not disturbed
MADE IN U.S.A.: Made in U.S.A. using U.S.A. sourced raw materials. No harmful chemicals or heavy metals. Safe for children and pets

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping.
